item.title: Matt Damon says he has never personally used gay slur
item.description: The Hollywood star had been criticised for saying he had only recently "retired" the insult.

item.title: Bennifer 2.0: How Jennifer Lopez and Ben Affleck got us talking again
item.description: How a viral photo of Jennifer Lopez and Ben Affleck exposed the internet's lust for nostalgia.

item.title: Dizzee Rascal: Rapper charged with assaulting woman
item.description: The rapper, whose real name is Dylan Mills, is charged with assault after an incident in south London.

item.title: Kathy Griffin reveals lung cancer diagnosis
item.description: Kathy Griffin is having half of her left lung removed, saying "doctors are very optimistic".

item.title: I'm a Celebrity...Get Me Out Here! to return to Wales in 2021
item.description: The 21st series of the hit ITV reality show is set to return to Gwrych Castle in November.

item.title: Jay Pickett: US actor dies on set of Western film
item.description: The star, described as "a true cowboy", dies aged 60 of a suspected heart attack while on horseback.

item.title: Hay director Peter Florence quits as gross misconduct claim upheld
item.description: Peter Florence was suspended in October following an internal complaint against him.

item.title: DaBaby dropped by US music festival Lollapalooza
item.description: The Chicago festival is the latest to cut ties, after the rapper's derogatory comments about people with HIV.

item.title: Hollywood plans £700m film and TV studios in Hertfordshire
item.description: Developers say the site could contribute £300m a year to the local economy and create 4,500 jobs.

item.title: Annabel Williams: Behind the scenes secrets of a celebrity vocal coach
item.description: She has voice-trained Amy Winehouse, Jennifer Hudson and reckons she can help anyone to sing.

item.title: EastEnders: 'I was ignorant about my schizophrenia'
item.description: Antonio Ferreira is using his personal experience to advise the soap on a storyline.

item.title: The X Factor: What became of the star-making hit show?
item.description: How the show that once topped viewing figures, and created big stars appears to have run its course.

item.title: The Strokes' Is This It at 20: Nudes, booze and 9/11
item.description: How the New York City band's 2001 debut album heralded "a new spirit in guitar music".

item.title: H.E.R. on shedding her anonymity and conquering R&B
item.description: For years the singer stayed in the shadows but after Grammy and Oscar wins she's ready to be seen.

item.title: Latitude festival: Magical, emotional... and a little bit frightening
item.description: Bands and fans describe the atmosphere at the UK's first full-capacity festival since 2019.

item.title: Alice in Wonderland sequel £5 coin 'evokes childhood memories'
item.description: The coin artist says all generations will enjoy the Through the Looking Glass themed scene.

item.title: Billie Eilish opens up to Clara Amfo on internet trolls
item.description: Eilish tells Amfo of her frustration with internet criticism in a new documentary.

item.title: KT Tunstall on her show-halting hearing loss
item.description: The singer-songwriter has put her touring plans on hold over concerns she could become completely deaf.

item.title: Dorset photographer shoots Star Wars Lego in cinematic style
item.description: A 34-year-old Dorset photographer is recreating cinematic sci-fi scenes using his Star Wars Lego kits.

item.title: Rapper ENNY talks sexual consent in latest track
item.description: The rising south London rapper talks about art imitating life in her new single.

item.title: Marble Arch Mound: 'I wouldn't pay £4 to walk up a hill'
item.description: The public reacts to London's newest tourist attraction, which is facing complaints of being incomplete.
